sub_title: (Neuro)Marketing Specialist at Nixon Digital | Marketer & Cognitive Psychologist | Pit main during Smash Bros. lunch break 🎮
summary:
(Neuro)Marketing Project Specialist, sometimes cosplayer, but always devoted to fuse my tri-forced background in Economics, Corporate Advertising and Applied Cognitive Psychology to get the job done.

Addicted to webcomics, gaming, animation and eurobeat music, my passion for the Entertainment Industry is never ending just as my manga collection.

🦸🏽‍♂️ The strongest potential for the Entertainment Industry comes by us. That's through the heroes we admire, love, and identify with, everyday. And that's why I worked on "Character Management", designing it to induce several benefit in fictional characters' goods sales whenever entertainment consumers get interested or identify with them (~87.5%).

📈 Indeed, Character Management can potentially bring much higher efficiency and effectiveness on revenue, if combined with Entertainment Marketing & Management strategies. Character Management for the Entertainment Industry has also been awarded with an Academic Honor Mention by Università degli Studi di Palermo, after its special committee. Available at: doi.org/10.13140/RG.2.2.20198.70720.

💬 Poke me in chat if you wanna know more about it. I swear I won't bore you with 115 pages of psychosocial trips 😇.

school.name: Istituto Tecnico Commerciale "Duca Abruzzi - Libero Grassi"

awards.title: Academic (Honor) Mention to "Character Management for the Entertainment Industry" (2022)
awards.description:
Character Management is an experimental add-on to Marketing Management and Advertising practices within the Entertainment Industry.

I've designed it to induce benefits related to the higher sales rate, awareness, and fidelity toward an Entertainment Brand when entertainment consumers get interested and/or identify with a fictional character, depending on perceived similarity between consumer and character (measured and compared with, e.g., the Big Five Inventory).

In July 27th, 2022, it has been awarded with the Academic Honor Mention by a special committee composed by Professors Boca S. (psychology), Fici A. (sociology), and Caracci M. (marketing).

projects.title: Seminar & Workshop "Social Media Manager VS. Fan e Cosplayer" (2021)
projects.description:
Seminar content (Manfredi Guarisco, former Advertising Strategist, reviewed by Prof. Gianna M. Cappello):

# Cosplayer-Oriented Social Media Management
• The use of fictional characters image, and Italian's SIAE copyright matters.
• Four Steps to let cosplayers cosplay our characters:
1 • Encourage. Instagram posts, calls for comic conventions, character awareness. An example from Webtoon's cosplayers "call" for LA Comicon on IG.
2 • Support. When it's hard to make a cosplay, make it easier for cosplayers. An example from NieR Automata's on Twitter.
3 • Share. Photos, videos, everything by company's creators at no-costs for cosplayers. Examples from Capcom's YT channel to NieR Automata's Twitter.
4 • Hire. Cosplayer-Influencer have their costumes ready? That's good: just hire them. An example from Bandai Namco and Yuriko Tiger.

# Prosumer Fans-Oriented Social Media Management
• Subtle legal differences between fansubs, fandubs, fanarts and fangames: when do an SMM should report OR encourage more fanmade work production, depending on company's guidelines and Italian's SIAE legislation? Who do we ask for our own firm's policies?
Open policies • How to encourage prosumer fans to produce more fanmade works.
Neutral policies • How (not) to enourage, neither warn over fanmade works (potentially risky for brand image).
Defensive policies • How and when to warn about potential copyright violations.

Workshop content (Manfredi Guarisco, former Advertising Strategist):
• Simulation of 3 different Social Media Management settings with a actions to be taken over one fanart, one amateur cosplayer and one cosplayer-influencer. What would you do? And why?

Conclusions (Gianna M. Cappello, Social Media Studies Associate Professor at University of Palermo, MED Journal Editor In-Chief):
• Today's and future research on the matter in Media Studies, Media Education and Cultural Studies.
• Opportunities of studying the subject in Corporate Advertising Master's degree at UNIPA.

projects.title: Seminar & Workshop "Cosplayer, Fandom e Carriera - Hobby da Curriculum" (2019)
projects.description:
First-ever official collaboration between Palermo Comic Convention and University of Palermo.

Seminar content (Manfredi Guarisco, reviewed by Prof. Gianna M. Cappello, 45 mins.):
• How and when your fanmade works can be considered working experience, considering Italian's SIAE and U.S.' DMCA copyright matters.
• Subtle legal differences between fansubs, fandubs, fanarts and fangames: how can I publish them? Which one is the most risky?
• How to recognize a "Defensive" company: the "closed" case of Pokémon Uranium.
• How to recognize a "Neutral" company: the case of The World Ends With You's Italian "taken" fansub by localization firms without asking the author.
• How to recognize an "Open" company: the case of Sonic CD.
• Final remarks on hard VS. soft skills for prosumer fans and cosplayers.

Workshop content (Harumizu, Cosplayer, 10K+ followers on Instagram, 30 mins.):
• How to create an efficient Instagram Cosplayer profile.
• Internal Instagram SERP tips & tricks: which hashtag for cosplayers? And how many?
• Let's make a post. Posing, lighting, copywriting and upload timing.
• Brand-Influencer collaborations with entertainment, make-up and cosplay brands: here's how to reach for them.

Additional Instagram insights for Cosplayers (Gianluca Montagna, Sr. Digital Marketer, 10 mins.):
• Instagram insights with a business account: where to look, and how.

Special thanks to Angelo Marchese, on connecting University of Palermo and Palermo Comic Convention through the official recognition of UNIPA's Patrocinato.

profile_positions.description: Developing and evolving models for consumer insights to enhance customer journeys and buying funnels, experimenting and creating (visually optimized) content for LinkedIn Campaigns advertising, videomaking, and last but not least, aiming for the Grand Final of our next Smash Bros. tournament.
profile_positions.title: Neuromarketing Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Implementing results from my previous eye-tracking research for an applied Neuromarketing Project: "Optimizing fast-scrolling advertising in Social Media: can Content Performance be improved by following Attentional Bias?" of 9 weeks.

• Created and ran two LinkedIn Ads campaigns with 3x CTR performance compared to industry standards.

• Developed a Visually Optimized LinkedIn Ads template, with a double A/B testing experiment for videos and still images (results for the optimized post vs. control: +21.2% views, +8.8% clicks; €7.64 cheaper CPM).

• Co-ran a Google Display Ads campaign, with six manually animated HTML 5 responsive banners made in Google Web Designer (optimized for Mobile, Desktop, Tablets, TVs; featured in The Guardian, BBC).

• Psychometric profiling and correlational analyses based on the Big 5 Inventory for better targeting (up to around 30% narrower audience; a = 0.694; p < .05).

• Created a Digital Maturity Model that measures exposure and prevention levels for European GDPR fines with Nixon's CEOs Marcel van Rijn and Sjoerd Heddema (for a faster customer journey; a = 0.760).

• Made it through the semifinals of our Super Smash Bros. Ultimate 2 vs. 2 tournament together with Team Nixon. Cooked Pasta alla Carbonara for the two winners (and for myself too ofc).
profile_positions.title: Neuromarketing Project Specialist (Stage)

profile_positions.description:
Research project "Activating our 'Visual RAM' for Multitasking: does Working Memory bias Visual Attention with multiple items and human emotions?", by Dr. Samson Chota, Manfredi Guarisco (2022-2023; field of Cognitive Psychology). We investigated the interaction between Visual Working Memory and Visual Covert Attention, measured by gaze behavior (Microsaccades) with an infrared P-CR Eye Tracker. Available at: http://dx.doi.org/10.13140/RG.2.2.29910.83527

• Conducted Eye-Tracking experiments for 46 subjects, measuring their Microsaccades after multiple simple or complex visual stimuli were memorized, to see if they both biased Visual Attention at the same time (spoiler: they did).

• Analyzed 410,000+ data points (microsaccades) with MATLAB (programming), ran statistical analyses for significance testing with Jamovi (T-Test; Repeated Measures ANOVA).

• Extracted 280 visual stimuli with a self-built Python script (with OpenCV and NumPy).

• Recruited more than 60 subjects, with a peak average of 7 subjects sign-ups per day. Cooked Pasta alla Carbonara reward for the two best performers I had in my experiments.

• Received a very positive feedback on my design for data visualization with graphs, both for significant and general data results. This also ensured a high experiment replicability with dedicated figures, both for the experiment structure and hypothesis testing (the concept behind it).

• Received a very positive feedback on organizational skills (handling and organizing participants' data, consent forms, raw data, results, graphs, science bureaucracy, etc.).
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Planning, creating and managing market and advertisement campaigns.

• Saved more than 40% on Advertising budget.

• Improved Facebook organic awareness by 915% in 2.5 months.

• 1st in Google SERP for "arredo ecosostenibile Palermo" and "Domus Design Store" in 3 months (Website, FB page and NAP).

• 3+ Years marketing planning based on randomized customer sales data (N=40+10), Google Trends, in-depth competitors analysis, keywords opportunity, psychosocial segmentation, for consumers and advertisement targeting (statistics with Jamovi and Excel).

• Created, managed and published an Ad Campain made of more than 30 posts across Instagram and Facebook (Meta businness suite), focused on Domus' re-selling brands (Versace, Ragno, Gardenia, etc.), and on our choosing plateau about sustainable Interior Design.

• Re-designed, managed and created 8 website pages in Wordpress, including keywording, SEO and graphic matters with both Adobe Suite and some CSS.

• Designed and sent to print 3 urban billboards (6 x 3 meters) with Illustrator. The last billboard is still running near Domus' showroom, since August 2022.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Manager
Tutor

profile_positions.description:
Non-profit advertising co-planning, creation and management to fight online hate behaviors with active bystanding.

• 1 Year marketing co-planning, based on psychosocial and media effects research about political extremism and radicalisation risks, with 3 targets subgroups (13 to 25 y.o.).

• Co-created, co-managed and co-published with peer colleagues from Greece and Netherlands an Ad Campain made of more than 10 posts (stills and videos) across Instagram and Facebook (Facebook businness suite; Instagram businness), focused on:
"Project COMMIT: COMMunication against radIcalisation and exTremism."
# Awareness on hateful content and behavior (e.g., homphobia, sinofobia, etc.);
# De-constructing stereotypes with impactful storytelling;
# Call-to-action for active bystanding to fight hate and extremism.

- Software used: Adobe Premiere Pro 2021 (with tons of plug-ins), Adobe Photoshop 2021, Google Sheets (to make out a content calendar), Google Trends (rough targeting paramenters and best Keywords for SEO).

- Hardware used: my Sony a6400 with Sigma 16mm f1.4, Sony 80mm f4, two colored lighting sources, other videomaking stuff, don't wanna get you bored at all on this.
